env_file_initialization.overview:
The project online Dev Env mode handles Phase 1: Environment Variable Population.
Defined in: ../../sdlc/shared/env-setup-workflow.md - "Two-Phase Approach" section - "Phase 1: Environment Variable Population" section
env_file_initialization.critical_principles: Defined in: ../../sdlc/shared/env-setup-workflow.md (Phase 1: Critical Principles section) - NEVER assume default values - Always explicitly ask for user-specific configuration - Ignore .env.sample example values
env_file_initialization.phase_1_workflow: Complete workflow defined in: ../../sdlc/shared/env-setup-workflow.md Sections: - "Phase 1: Environment Variable Population" - "Step 1 - Check and Create .env" - "Step 2 - GIT_TOKEN Setup (Required)" - "Step 3 - Jira Integration Setup (Optional)" - "Step 4 - Validation"
env_file_initialization.interaction_patterns: Defined in: ../../sdlc/shared/env-setup-workflow.md (Interaction Patterns section) - First-time setup (no .env file) - Partial setup (.env exists but missing vars) - Jira addition (add Jira to existing .env)
env_file_initialization.env_merge_strategy:
CRITICAL: When target project already has an existing .env file, use merge strategy defined in 1_env_merge_strategy.xml to append new variables WITHOUT overwriting existing values.
See 1_env_merge_strategy.xml for complete merge workflow and implementation.
env_file_initialization.mode_behavior:
Execute Phase 1 workflow from: ../../sdlc/shared/env-setup-workflow.md
When .env exists: Use merge strategy (see env_merge_strategy section above) When .env missing: Follow "Step 1 - Check and Create .env" in shared pattern
